page.title: 14Transport - Winchfield Area.
page.content: Over 200 000 passengers use{Winchfield {station}each year making it the{27th {busiest station in Hampshire.}About 3/4 travel eastwards, mainly to London on the 1/2 hourly service. There are 36 trains in each direction daily that stop at Winchfield. The busiest times are from 07-00 to 09-00 & 17-00 to 19- 30. There is one member of staff on each shift at Winchfield Station. {Fleet Service Station on the M3}was opened in 1973 by Trust House Forte.It is set amongst pine trees & has WC's, Shops, filling-stations & several cafes/restaurants. 60% of the trade is on the west-bound side. From 11th-18th August, 50 000 meals were consumed there.{Other roads}in the block are mainly country lanes.{Alder Valley}& {Hampshire Bus}run 1-2 hourly services via the station, Chatter Alley & Hit- ches Lane. For{CANAL}see{'TOURISM'.
